message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

This paper deals with active sensor planning for object tracking tasks, which is a common problem in robotics (cs.RO). The proposed method uses contextual information to estimate the possible location of a missing target, which involves computer vision techniques (cs.CV) and machine learning algorithms (cs.AI). The use of Bayesian networks and Monte Carlo particle filtering also suggests a focus on probabilistic modeling and inference (cs.LG). Finally, the use of a Partially-Observable Markov Decision Process to determine the robot's navigation actions suggests a focus on control and decision-making (cs.SY).
